item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Since we're all going to die, it's obvious that when and how don't matter." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Mother died today. Or maybe yesterday; I can't be sure." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I felt the urge to reassure him that I was like everybody else, just like everybody else." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I explained to him, however, that my nature was such that my physical needs often got in the way of my feelings." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "And it was like knocking four quick times on the door of unhappiness." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I realized then that a man who had lived only one day could easily live for a hundred years in prison. He would have enough memories to keep him from being bored" -- Albert Camus

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "Man is something that shall be overcome.... Man is a rope, tied between beast and overman -- a rope over an abyss... What is great in man is that he is a bridge and not an end." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I change too quickly: my today refutes my yesterday. When I ascend I often jump over steps, and no step forgives me that." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description:
"I have learned to walk: since then I have run. I have learned to fly: since then I do not have to be pushed in order to move.
Now I am nimble, now I fly, now I see myself under myself, now a god dances within me." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You know these things as thoughts, but your thoughts are not your experiences, they are an echo and after-effect of your experiences: as when your room trembles whe na carriage goes past. I however am sitting in the carriage, and often I am the carriage itself. Ina man who thinks like this, the dichotomy between thinking and feeling, intellect and passion, has really disappeared. He feels his thoughts. He can fall in love with an idea. An idea can make him ill." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "But it is the same with man as with the tree. The more he seeks to rise into the height and light, the more vigorously do his roots struggle earthword, downword, into the dark, the deep - into evil." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You say 'I' and you are proud of this word. But greater than this- although you will not believe in it - is your body and its great intelligence, which does not say 'I' but performs 'I'." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I love those who do not know how to live, except by going under, for they are those who cross over." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A little wisdom is indeed possible; but this blessed security have I found in all things, that they prefer--to DANCE on the feet of chance." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Soroosh add a quote by Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm
item.description: "I tell you: one must still have chaos in one, to give birth to a dancing star. I tell you: you have still chaos in you." -- Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm
